newsitem.title: USA: UNC buys private aircraft component maker.
newsitem.headline: UNC buys private aircraft component maker.

text.p: UNC Inc said it has acquired Seattle-based aircraft components maker Stearns Co in a transaction that reflects growth in the commercial aviation market.

UNC said it will integrate Stearns Co into its existing operations at UNC Aerostructures in Seattle in order to meet production demands from current and future airplane programs at Boeing Co. Both companies recently have won long- term contracts to manufacture hardware for the Boeing 777 and 737.
UNC said its anticipates the acquisition will add $30 million to its $250 million manufacturing backlog.
UNC's aviation services include airframe maintenance, modification and retrofit services, and avionics and aircraft interior installations.
